meanings.definition: A loud, confused noise or uproar
meanings.sent1: The children's hullabaloos could be heard from across the playground.
meanings.sent2: The hullabaloos of the city streets filled the night air.
meanings.sent3: The hullabaloos of the party startled the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The hullabaloos of the thunderstorm shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The hullabaloos of the crowd at the concert were deafening.

meanings.sent1: The hullabaloos in the classroom disrupted the lesson.
meanings.sent2: There was a hullabaloo in the market when the prices suddenly dropped.
meanings.sent3: The hullabaloos in the library made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent4: The hullabaloos of the protest could be heard for miles.
meanings.sent5: The hullabaloos of the traffic jam caused delays for hours.

meanings.sent1: She hullabaloos whenever she doesn't get her way.
meanings.sent2: Please don't hullabaloo about such a small issue.
meanings.sent3: The children hullabalooed when they were told it was bedtime.
meanings.sent4: He hullabaloos every time his favorite team loses.
meanings.sent5: The dog hullabaloos whenever the doorbell rings.
